intro: Reseda alphonsi var. scabridula, commonly known as the scabrous reseda, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky soils. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving them a rough texture. Reseda alphonsi var. scabridula is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in dye production.
